p: The known limonoid, proceranolide ( 152) (Fig. 32) was found in the leaves of Ekebergia capensis (Meliaceae) by Irungu et al. [ 80]. The isolated compound was then evaluated in vitro against the D6 and W2 strains of P. falciparum. This compound exhibited weak antiplasmodial activity against the D6 and W2 strains with IC 50 values of 84.7 and 150.2 µM, respectively [ 80].
